references.reason: This paper introduces PAL, a program-aided language model approach that enhances reasoning capabilities, which is a key topic discussed in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Scaling test-time compute with open models
references.reason: This paper provides a foundational study on test-time scaling, a central method analyzed in the target paper, offering valuable insights into compute optimization strategies.

references.paper_title: Scaling LLM test-time compute optimally can be more effective than scaling model parameters
references.reason: This paper directly addresses compute-optimal test-time scaling, a core concept of the target paper, providing a comparative analysis of different scaling methods and their impact on performance.
This paper introduces the MATH dataset and the process reward model concept, both crucial to the experiments and analysis conducted in the target paper.

references.paper_title: DeepSeek-R1: Incentivizing reasoning capability in LLMs via reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper presents a state-of-the-art reasoning model, DeepSeek-R1, that serves as a benchmark for comparison against the smaller models evaluated using the compute-optimal test-time scaling strategy.
